attributes.action: make an URGENT public statement to confirm or deny that in future, in accordance with the facilities provided to MPs who 'wrongly' and 'by mistake' and 'during a lapse in good judgement' claimed expenses that weren't, ANY and every benefit cheat or fraudster is to be given an opportunity to pay the money back to clear their name, before legal action is taken against them.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It appears that MPs can absolve themselves of guilt by simply paying back the public money they stole and declaring that they 'made a mistake' or suffered 'a lapse in good judgement'.  Benefit cheats and other fraudsters must also, therefore, be given the opportunity to pay the money back and declare themselves to have made a mistake or error of judgement to avoid prosecution

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
